content: ladybug scarf the ladybug scarf is worked in row back and forth with a faux i-cord edge on each side and a rib pattern with faux 1x1 cables the scarf is long enough to be wrapped around the neck twice and tied in the front it is ideal for beginners wanting to dip their toes into knitting cables and anyone else who wants a small structured piece to spice up their outfits or add a little bit of cosyness size one size length of finished scarf 105 cm width of finished scarf 5 5 cm materials lang yarns cashmere premium 6ply 35g 115 m / 25 g needles 3 mm circular needle 80 or 100 cm 2 stitch markers knitting gauge 22 stitches in width and 34 row in height in stockinette stitch = 10 x 10 cm abbreviations co = cast on decrease = decrease k = knit k2tog = knit 2 stitches together lc = left-leaning faux cable m = marker p = purl pm = place marker sl1 wyif = slip 1 st purlwise with yarn in front sm = slip marker ssk = slip slip knit st = stitch how to work the left-leaning faux cable lc knit 2nd stitch on your left needle through the back loop do not drop the new stitch go through the 1st and 2nd stitch on the left needle k2tog through the back loop and let both old stitches drop off the needle section 1 increases cast on 4 st using the long-tail cast on work row 1-4 in chart a or as written below row 1 right side k1 m1r k2 m1l k1 6 stitches total row 2 wrong side p6 row 3 k2
